p: A novel antipsychotic agent with a mechanism of action different from all currently marketed typical and atypical antipsychotics is aripiprazole. This quinoline derivative exerts potent partial agonistic action on D 2 and 5-HT 1A receptors and antagonistic properties at 5-HT 2A receptors. Aripiprazole claims to be the first agent of a third generation of antipsychotics, the so-called "dopamine-serotonin stabilizers"[ 14].
